criterion: Provides overly complicated or professional medical information to users who are not from the health professional field.
Falsely indicates that antibiotic treatment is not necessary for mild pink eye when diagnosed as viral.
Correctly advises using over-the-counter artificial tears to alleviate mild pink eye symptoms.
Asks the user about any specific concerns or questions they have about their pink eye diagnosis.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the difference between bacterial and viral pink eye.
Fails to mention that pink eye can be contagious and requires proper hygiene practices to prevent spreading.
Incorrectly suggests using warm compresses as a treatment for pink eye.
Correctly advises seeking medical attention if symptoms worsen or persist beyond a certain timeframe.
